title: 117th Division (Imperial Japanese Army)
text:
The was an <a href="infantry">infantry</a> <a href="Division%20%28military%20unit%29">division</a> of the <a href="Imperial%20Japanese%20Army">Imperial Japanese Army</a>. Its <a href="call%20sign">call sign</a> was the . It was formed 10 July 1944 in <a href="Xinxiang">Xinxiang</a> as a type-C(hei) security division, simultaneously with the <a href="114th%20Division%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">114th</a>, <a href="115th%20Division%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">115th</a> and <a href="118th%20Division%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">118th</a> divisions. The nucleus for the formation was the <a href="14th%20Independent%20Infantry%20Brigade%20%28Imperial%20Japanese%20Army%29">14th independent infantry brigade</a>. The division was initially assigned to the <a href="Twelfth%20Army%20%28Japan%29">12th army</a>.
Action.
Although slated for the <a href="Battle%20of%20West%20Henan%E2%80%93North%20Hubei">Battle of West Henan–North Hubei</a>, the "117th division" was reassigned to the <a href="Forty-Fourth%20Army%20%28Japan%29">44th army</a> and sent to <a href="Taonan">Taonan</a> in April 1945. During the <a href="Soviet%20invasion%20of%20Manchuria">Soviet invasion of Manchuria</a>, the "117th division" was tasked with the defense of <a href="Liaoyuan">Liaoyuan</a> and has surrendered to <a href="Red%20Army">Red Army</a> in <a href="Gongzhuling">Gongzhuling</a>. The last soldiers were returned to Japan only in 1963.
